info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 22 at 10:57PM MDT until September 23 at 3:00AM MDT by NWS Cheyenne WY
info.description:
Although the Flash Flood Warning will be allowed to expire on time at 1100 PM, heavy rainfall continues with gauges showing up to 2 and half inches of rainfall this evening. Flooding concerns will linger through 300 AM.
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of panhandle Nebraska, including the following county, Dawes.
* WHEN...Until 300 AM MDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1057 PM MDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Overflowing poor drainage areas have already caused flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen since 800 pm. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are expected over the area. Rainfall is expected to taper off to light showers over the next 2 hours. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chadron, Chadron Municipal Airport, Chadron State Park, Red Cloud Campground and Chadron State Park Campground. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM MDT TUESDAY
